wikipedia_page.main: Gordon W. Ratcliffe (24 Aug 1925 - Dec 1981) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s and 1950s. He played at representative level for Great Britain and England, and at club level for Wigan and later arch-rivals St Helens, as a wing, or centre, i.e. number 2 or 5, or, 3 or 4.
